comments.raw_text:
The top left corner of the browser window is a hot area for user tracking. It contains the bright orange Firefox button, the Back button, the first tab, the identity block and beginning of the site address. Right now it's visually complex and I think we'd improve the user experience and remove some visual friction by simplifying it some.

Attached is a comparison of the current layout on a Windows Aero theme and my proposed changes. Changes include moving the Firefox button left and aligning the first tab's left border with the toolbar and content area left border. (the narrower window frame is another bug.)
